website_summaries.verdict: It's an acceptable choice if you need a larger model, but if water heating time and quality concern you, check out other models.
pros: Features jets that create bubbles and waves similar to standard hot tubs
Spacious design with room for up to 6 people
Water heats fast and stays warm, and seating is comfortable
cons: Heavy and a bit awkward to fill

customer_reviews.title: Other than this it worked great..
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for Christmas and it worked amazingly for about 2 weeks. Then we have an error flashing E1 & END on the screen and shutting the power off. Going to try to replace it since it's within the time allowed and see what we see. Other than this it worked great....for a couple weeks... Updated 2/22/17 Is there a reason why I had to pay $150 in shipping to return your defective item to you to get a replacement? Almost half the cost of the whole freaking hot tub to return something that was a factory defect. This is definitely the most disappointing experience I've had with your company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unlocatable leak and no help online or anywhere else. Don't wait. Don't think you didn't follow the directions. Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Won't stay inflated, looked everywhere for any leaks including valves. Continues to not stay inflates and unable to get any help. We have been dealing with this slight leak for over 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia M.

customer_reviews.title: Not holding air... No response from Coleman
customer_reviews.text: Trying to deal with a faulty cover, first Amazon then Coleman have done nothing. There is a leak in the cover floar, which is exactly in the seam of where it was melted together, indicating a manufacturing defect. Patching it is futile, because as soon as air gets put into it, the patch is pulled off. Amazon said it wasn't their problem. Coleman hasn't responded.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only had hot tub for about a month and started ...
customer_reviews.text: Only had hot tub for about a month and started leaking air. Received new one from Coleman which took several phone calls and emails. After several weeks we received new hot tub, set it up and after about one week this time it was leaking air.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne

customer_reviews.title: Good for a short time
customer_reviews.text: Used my spa off and on for about 3 months then one day I came outside to get in and one side had collapsed so I called Coleman service number and they told me nothing they could do I would have to re-buy after all the money spent on this spa now its in box and collecting dust will be trashing soon
customer_reviews.author: donald

customer_reviews.title: Breaks in 2 months and price gouged.
customer_reviews.text: It seemed good at first, although the touchpad was very hard to use, once your fingers got wet it was bear impossible to get it to respond. The pump/heater auto shuts off in 2-3 days, so if you forget to go turn in on and off every couple days then your hot tub won’t circulate and it will get dirty and cold, takes 12+hours to heat. After 2 months the pump/heater died and the touchpad stopped responding altogether. Don’t buy. They also jacked up the price from 350 to 800+ because they thought they could screw people staying home due to covid19. Dont support this. It is a product that won’t last the summer and is overpriced by 2x+.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Heater stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Heater on the pump went up and not eligible for return and you can't just purchase a new pump highly recommend not wasting your money
customer_reviews.author: Erin S. Spurry

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic investment but slow heater.
customer_reviews.text: Smartest family gift I purchased! I won't pontificate except to say that this was an absolutely wonderful investment. Bought it for weeks ago and we use it consistently. No issues. Be prepared that the heater will only keep the water 1°/hour.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: EVERY O'ring leaks.
customer_reviews.text: After 8 months of use every o'ring on the water side of the pump unit is leaking. (I MEAN EVERY ONE on the water side!) The o'ring material is to soft and flattens out after a short time. A couple of leaks can be fixed by tightening hose clamps but the ones on the water pump and heater element need to be changed out. I've tried emailing Bestway support and have never gotten a reply. They offer a link on their website to a parts page that is broken and trying to source replacement o'rings is a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford D. Betterley

customer_reviews.title: used it three times and now the tub won't stay ...
customer_reviews.text: used it three times and now the tub won't stay inflated. can't find any leaks or holes, just throw 400 dollars away
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item and used it 4 times before the pump went bad. Rattled and was so loud you couldn't stand to be near it. It was still under warranty so they did send me a "new" pump which did the same dang thing, rattled and loud. Sounded like a freight train. They sent me a 3rd pump which was the same and told me that they were not going to send me another one even though I had seen video proof of how these pumps had been acting. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Bush

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I order this but ended up sending it back. For some reason the put a drain plug on the bottom and it never sealed correctly. Leaked a little bit. Glad it was outside on concrete patio. Also it was very loud and not relaxing. So loud I could not even hear me stereo turned up but my neighbors did. Also felt like I was in a witches cauldron they way the bubbles were. Not an expensive tub and seemed well made for the money but with the leak on the bottom and noise not for me.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this hot tub. Best $320 I’ve ever spent!! Keeps the temp even when I’ve been in it for 2 hrs. Easy to maintain once I figured out the chemicals. Couldn’t be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Eli'smama

customer_reviews.title: Great spa for the price, once you manage E02 error
customer_reviews.text: Likes; 1. Company stands by their warranty-no hassle replacement parts. 2. Price 3. 360° air jets 4. Easy to setup & break down for storage; the built in air pump is uaed to inflate & deflate it. 5. Heavy duty constructed shell (use foam mats as flooring to protect from ground puncture.(*do not leave it out in 90°F+ weather=air expands) 6. Portable Dislikes; 1. Does not fit 4-6 "adults" comfortably. Perfect for two. 2. "E02 ERROR" SENSOR - JUST CLEAN FILTERS & ADD CHLORINE TABS to get PH Level up to 3. I do 7 to rid of slimy walls. (this fixes the error everytime for me).
customer_reviews.author: Kenny D

customer_reviews.title: Great for an achy body in retirement.
customer_reviews.text: I set this up yesterday afternoon and started heating it at 7 pm and it was up to 104 by 5 pm. I sat in it for 20 minutes and it was awesome, with a lot of bubble action. If it gets too cold this winter in Montana, I will put it in the basement under the window and possibly a dehumidifier. I have arthritis and sciatic nerve problems and right now I feel wonderful. Also, I am 66 years old and assembled it myself in 3 hours, with lots of breaks. The one thing I am not happy with is that while using the jets, the heater will not operate. With winter coming on, this may be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Wildhorse

customer_reviews.title: This will save your sanity during quarantine.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to kill the feelings of sadness my wife experiences while under quarantine due to the recent viral explosion. I couldn't be more pleased. Although I'm bummed that it didn't come with an insulation pad like the videos show, assembly was EASY, the temperature holds like a champ (unless you use the Jets) and it's the best part of our coronavirus quarantine experience. I wish they included information on chlorine tablet size, number of tablets (instead of picture) and recommended chemical levels for this number of gallons. But if you put in the work to figure it out it's well worth it. AND YA CAN'T BEAT THE PRICE!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Logan

customer_reviews.title: No instructions, doesn’t hold air
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because my friend has one and told me it was great. Mine came with several holes that I had to patch as soon as I blew it up. There were no instructions in the box. Thankfully my friend walked me through the set up. There must be more holes because this thing deflates over night, every night! I have not been able to enjoy this once since setting it up. Very dissatisfied with this product. I will inflate again today and if I still can’t find any more holes I will be calling the company for a replacement or full refund.
customer_reviews.author: miamiVice

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Why are these $300 MORE than just s few years ago??????? Glad I didnt pay anywhere near that much for ours. Cool for what it is but I wouldn't waste the money on another one. After 2 years the pump started leaking, we also ended up with water leaking out through the air tube. Whole thing went in the trash. NOT worth $800!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Bestway doesn't respond
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased in February but not taken out of the box until 5/3/2020. We inflated and filled the hot tub. The next day it was significantly deflated. Have tried to contact Bestway Service Department twice (phone doesn't work) but uploaded pictures of credit card receipt and hot tub deflating to site using a form. No responses either time although the site states there will be contact in two business days. Tried to contact Amazon but their phones are offline as well. A warranty is only as good as the service given.
customer_reviews.author: R. McDonough

customer_reviews.title: I'm having problems with the switch
customer_reviews.text: In general, I like this product. The heater works quickly, and the bubbles work well. I particularly like the inflatable cover. However... it arrived without any instructions or manual. It's pretty intuitive, so that's not a problem. The switch seems to be a bit of a problem. I have to turn it off at the breaker several times, then wait a few minutes, in order to turn it on at all. Then I have to reset everything from the beginning. After it gets going for about 5 minutes, the switch freezes up, and I can't turn off the bubbles or make any adjustments without turning it off, waiting, and starting again. Other than that... it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with this product, for two main reasons...first, it exceeded my expectations about how good it really would be. It was a lot of money, so I was very hesitant, but I am very pleased with it. Secondly, customer service from Bestway USA was excellent! After using this for the first two days, it became apparent that there was a slow air leak in the main tub. So, I went online and completed the warranty claim process on their website and by the end of that day, they had shipped a replacement tub via FedEx. It came two days later, and is working perfectly. That's customer service! I highly recommend this product and this company.
customer_reviews.author: D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: One to Two years before repairs
customer_reviews.text: Bought a little over two years ago. Used for 5 months each season Oct/nov-March/April. We kept it in the sunroom so it was very protected. Pump has one year warranty, ours went out two weeks after warranty was up but company was good and replaced. We just had our second major issue where the air line that makes the jets bubble pulled away. Using a strong adhesive now to try and repair to get more life out if it. It is a good entry level hot tub, but if adhesive holds I'll be surprised to get another year or two out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seals failed after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: After a 11 months of use our hot tub developed a small leak. It was very difficult to find but it was coming from where the water return in the hot tub connects to the hose which leads back to the pump/heater. I tried to service the seal and replace it but it appeared that everything was glued together and couldn't be taken apart so I ended up destroying the hot tub in the process of trying to repair it. If I buy another inflatable hot tub I'm going to try to buy one that is more serviceable.... These things should and could last a long time if the engineers design them to be serviceable.
customer_reviews.author: D. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Coleman/Amazon duped me for $700
customer_reviews.text: After just 90 days and having used it maybe 5 times I go to use it now and the power cord is not working. I just purchased this for over $670 on May 28,2020. Finding Coleman customer service is impossible. No one is helping to troubleshoot. I don’t have almost $700 to hand to Amazon. I will call Amazon. I want my money back or a product that works!! Buyer beware no Coleman customer service available to answer questions, parts, nothing! So frustrated and I feel duped!!
customer_reviews.author: Kimora

customer_reviews.title: Good value per Gallon
customer_reviews.text: We put this up earlier in our hot summer to help us deal with the lockdowns. Since we don't really want or have space for a full spa, this seemed to be a good purchase. We have been surprised by how much we like the spa. Couple of comments: VERY comfortable - no hard surfaces and sturdy. The "written" assembly instructions are laughable, but we got it working. While four adults could probably fit, two is plenty. Just because it is inflatable, does not mean it does not take much care. It takes the same level of care as a regular spa - rinse out the filters, keep the chemicals balanced, keep it clean. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: tracy2078

customer_reviews.title: Waited 2 months to review
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviewer who wrote the detailed review and the top of the reviewers, and followed their recommendations. It's been over 2 months, and I use my hot tub regularly, and my husband and I both love it. Maintenance is easy, and it will fit in a lot of different spaces. The hot tub will turn off after 72 hours, but if you use it regularly, it never really shuts off. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Buy at $300!
customer_reviews.text: March 2017- Aug 2020. It was a good run for $350. The heating element clogged after one year. I should have flushed it monthly. Taking it apart to clean it failed and would cause the circuit to trip instead. Rigged a $100 Ecotemp propane heater instead to keep the water hot for hours. Nice! Last month the air hose ripped in the tub but looks patchable. The Chinese air blower burned out this month and is not repairable. All Chinese blowers are 220v. Replaced with a 1 HP, 110v, 5.7in Amatek blower. Issue is the blower housing is made for a 5.4in blower so had to modify the housing.
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: GREAT choice if you only want a hot tub once in while and don't want to spend big $$$
customer_reviews.text: Used off and on for 5 months and pleasantly surprised. Has yet to leak air or water. Works close enough to a real spa that you won't regret spending more, friends love it. Some quibbles that may get overlooked: You can only run the spa setting for 20 minutes, during which you can't run the heater. so if you're thinking of hanging out for an extended time, forget it. FYI takes about 12-14 hours to heat up from 67 to 104 degrees, so do plan in advance.
customer_reviews.author: timothy d fisher

customer_reviews.title: Read the troubleshooting info! please.
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up, oops, after 7 days would only be 100-102 degrees, no codes on the display, read the directions/ troubleshooting: (download the manual to ibooks), Solution, changed the little filters, back to 104 within 2 hours. Yea! Keep those filters clean/replaced. The filter under the chorine dispenser got the dirtiest, the other filter not so much. Bot a box of intex filters on amazon. Love this spa.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Awesome Hot Tub!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t sure how this hot tub was going to compare to my Jacuzzi Catalina 8 person with lounger I had at my previous house but I bought it anyhow and I am Really Impressed I actually feel it’s more comfortable to relax in. Very easy to set up.It took 10 minutes total set up time. This is an Amazingly Awesome hot tub well worth the purchase price, I highly recommend this hot tub.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Was Skeptical but pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to use while waiting for my deck & hot tub plans and permits to move forward and I was shocked at how easy it was to setup and it is more comfortable for my age then a fiberglass hot tub. Wife and I still debating just reinforcing new deck and moving this tub or spending 20X on the model we were thinking - still talking and using the hot tub. It easy to get in and out, cover and controls are easy to use. Still working on the chemicals but that is true of all spas.
customer_reviews.author: Wildduck

customer_reviews.title: Look No Further!
customer_reviews.text: We have had ours 2 years. An initial problem with the pump which was taken care of promptly with a new pump they sent. No hassle. That's the ONLY problem we've had. It doesn't lose an ounce of air pressure in the pump nor in the tub itself. We fill it at the beginning of summer and don't have to add air for 8 months when we break it down. It heats to 104° and stays hot a good amount of time! Our electric bill has increased, but, duh. Not more than I expected or consider reasonable. I SO recommend this item without reservation! Enjoy!! 😁
customer_reviews.author: Mapache

customer_reviews.title: parts missing
customer_reviews.text: REALLY disappointed - arrived with parts missing; the rubber gasket attaching the pump to the tub is missing - water leaks out, completely unusable.
customer_reviews.author: CindyKodak

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a few months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a few months, put it away in the heated basement. Took it out to set it up and the pump is leaking. Can't purchase the pump separately. Tore it apart to check it. Seemed ok but after heating the water to 82 the pump burnt out and now can't get anyone from Coleman to respond. We bought a portable tub because we knew we would have to move it and didnt have room for a full size square tub. Total waste of money
customer_reviews.author: sherrill George

customer_reviews.title: Only lasts less than a year
customer_reviews.text: This hot tub, is really nice. But the problem is, it only lasts about less than one year. It has a one-year warranty, but try to get your warranty validated, and your replacement parts, is almost impossible. My warranty expires September 2020. I submitted a warranty problem, on my filter which broke. I have been waiting three months now, For my filter to come in. You can’t call them, you have to apply online. The phone number they give you doesn’t work. So you have to request a phone call. Finally, they called me back. But I’m still waiting to get my pump.
customer_reviews.author: Gilda

customer_reviews.title: VERY disappointing!!!😠 DONOT Buy
customer_reviews.text: Instruction booklet is printed in very teesy weensy print. Diagrams are also very small. The large fitting that goes from the pump to the spa is leaking badly...cannot be tightened to stop leaking. NO customer service number to call. Webesite said a callback could take from seven to 10 days. In the interim the water that we have to pay for is leaking badly. Have not had time to check out the other features so I am giving all 1 star ratings. If I do not hear back from bestway very soon.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Kate

customer_reviews.title: Great little hot tub
customer_reviews.text: As promised, a rugged inflatable hot tub, heater works fine, slow but gets there and maintains water at the desired temperature, the bubbles work great also. I inserted chlorine tablets in the dispenser and keeps water fresh but I need more pool products as I have needed to change water almost weekly. One of the tubes started leaking and i just wrapped some Teflon tape on it and voila!
customer_reviews.author: MiguelO

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy. I would say it seats four
customer_reviews.text: Very Sturdy. I would say it seats four, can't see six people fitting in this spa. There was absolutely NO DVD with instructions AND the single sheet of paper with instructions was little or no help. Not big on words, just few pictures with arrows. Still kind of working out the bugs, but will look on line for some sort of instruction booklet. Otherwise, I love it. The flow of the bubbles is super and it massages by back great. Since I have arthritis and osteo-arthritis in my back and hips, this seems to be helping. Haven't used the heater, since God sent us a heat wave this week...
customer_reviews.author: jmuzar

customer_reviews.title: Incredible...curious to see my electric bill. 😎😬😍
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tub. I built a privacy structure around it. I’d be lying if I said I wasn’t in there for an early morning dip in the buff. :) Absolutely easy to set up and really very intuitive. I am having an issue where it’s throwing an error code (E02) and the pump doesn’t appear to be working. I’ll update this review when I hear back from customer support. I just filed a claim today (5/4/2020). Still waiting on a callback (5/6/2020). I heard from them 5/7/2020 and they handled my issue to my satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Got_it

customer_reviews.title: 600- BUCKS DOWN THE DRAIN
customer_reviews.text: y second Coleman spa, unfortunately, this one has broken twice. Both times in 6 months the heating element has gone out. The first time through covid, applied for warranty repair, and Bestway never spoke to us personnally. But they sent a new generator. We were very pleased but after 3 months the heating element was out again. Now we cannot get any help PERIOD> No one returns our calls, or emails. Yes covid is happening, but we need help. We spent 600- on this product. All we need is a new heating element. Cannot recommend purchasing this product,.
customer_reviews.author: cecilia8

customer_reviews.title: Miserable experience
customer_reviews.text: This product malfunctioned again and again. We worked for three hours trying to get it to operate with no success. There is no one to help you at the end of an 800 number. You must only contact the company by email and then wait for a response. I cannot ask my friends to come back again and again to help with this project. Their customer service was nonexistent. They make it look so easy but trust me it is not.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn H

customer_reviews.title: Leaks...
customer_reviews.text: This hot tub was great at first, although it does shut off after around three days. The reason I had to return it was that both the hot tub and the top insulator had internal leaks that actually let water in. The main tub kept losing pressure and I would have to keep pumping it up. The other thing was that the floor of the tub, while nice and cushioned, was separating and you could feel what seemed like an air bubble in the bottom. I really wanted this to work, but the quality is just not there... Amazon is still the best with returns though.... Long lived Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good Value but..
customer_reviews.text: Running the heater continuously for a month in a warm July raised my electric bill $150! Yikes, not cheap to run by any measure. Slow air leak developed after one year and I can't for the life of me find it. Suspect it's internal to one of the valves or external connections and inaccessible. It's a great way to find out if you really want a hot tub without investing thousands of dollars in a "real" spa, but is no substitute for the real thing in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Spa leeks with air and also water!!
customer_reviews.text: Used it for 2 months, disassembled and stored in house, when I put it back up there was air leaking out of it, and after I filled it with water, went to check it the next morning and all the water was drained out. All but 4 inches. I found one spot on the rim where the air was coming out, and patched it, but I still haven't found the problem with the water. I did notice a small dripping from a connection...I trying to find a way to contact the seller here on Amazon and I am not finding any link, so I feel very dissatisfied. If it lasted more than 2 months that would have been great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis

customer_reviews.title: There is NO CUSTOMER SUPPORT!
customer_reviews.text: This product worked fine for two months. Then it started tripping the GFCI breaker every time the heater turned on. For two days now I have been trying to contact customer service to file a warranty claim. The support phone number printed on the spa is a recording telling you to "go on-line and file a warranty claim". The on-line form won't let me create an account to file a claim. The other phone number they sent me is dead without even ringing on the other end. They do not want to talk to their customers! Do not buy this product!
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: I love this hot tub
customer_reviews.text: Okay so when I first saw this I was super skeptical. Let me tell you how thrilled I am that I took a chance. My whole family is thrilled with this hot tub. It's comfortable, sturdy, and so ridiculously easy to set up and maintain. I've had it for a few months so far and there's only been 3 days we haven't used it. If you are at all on the fence about this, I urge you to try it. It's absolutely worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennie

customer_reviews.title: Non return valve leaking brand new out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the tub two years ago because I needed a new pump. I just opened the actual tub yesterday, filled it up and it lost almost all of the water overnight. This is a brand new tub. The A valve, or non return valve is leaking. Guess it's too late for a refund, but it is very frustrating, as it seems to be a fairly common problem, based on some YouTube searches I've done.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannette Sachs

customer_reviews.title: Heating function sucks major rocks.
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this jacuzzi more than I do the actual item. So my chief complaint here is the heat. It’s soooooooooo waaaaaaay very weak. It takes a full day to get it hot. And by hit I mean to barely 100. All day just to hover in the high 90’s. Moreover once we get in it drops to about 93-94 within 20 minutes. A jacuzzi to me, is supposed to be like in the low 100’s. I so want to return this.
customer_reviews.author: Paco

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this for a little over a month now & we love it! It was easy to assemble & easy to use. The bubbles are pretty powerful! The filters are decent - we do need a skimmer to get some things out (grass clippings, bugs, etc) that the filters aren’t picking up. I would say you could comfortably fit 3 adults in there - 4 would work if everyone sat cross legged. Our electric bill went up about 10 dollars, but since it’s in the sun most of the day, we only turn the heater on before we go in.
customer_reviews.author: JDK

customer_reviews.title: Broke day 1
customer_reviews.text: Excitedly set our up. One connection kept leaking. I thought maybe it was cross threaded so it took it off and made sure it was straight. It still leaked. I tried to tighten the connector and the piece broke. Now I'm searching for a replacement part before I've even got in the tub. Terrible start Update: No contact from customer service. Unable to find replacement part. DEFINITELY WOULD NOT RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd spa I have bought in the last 3 years. I love the spa but I consistently have issues with the pump failing. When I try to put in a claim the web site fails after filling in the information. When I called and was on hold for 25 minutes before I was told that they would send me a link via email that I could submit my information on. They never sent the email so I had to call again. I love the spa when it is working, but I certainly won't purchase another of this type.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Horton

customer_reviews.title: GOOD FOR THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup and straight forward. I have had it for 2 months now. So far it works great and is a perfect alternative to an expensive one. Very relaxing. Only down fall is the temperature drops quickly when using the bubbles but stays hot for hours with out them on. Keep the cover on it when not using to keep it hot ( will not heat up all the way without cover) keep in mind this a cheap alternative ( not gonna be perfect ) but serves the same purpose over all. I like it. So far no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this hot tub so much! I was in it every night and it made my working from home manageable! However after having it 5 weeks the hot tub pumpstopped working. I contacted bestway and was told they have no replacements at this time so I may go the rest of the summer not able to use it. I am very sad. A lot of money for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Itskov

customer_reviews.title: Best $350 EVER spent at Amazon - hot tub in a box? Better than I imagined
customer_reviews.text: Even though there was no shortage of 5-star reviews, I still had my doubts. But after an $8000 estimate to install a serious hot tub, I thought "How can I go wrong with $350?" I've been using more than a year - through winter and summer and I'm really impressed with Coleman's ability to engineer a blow-up hot tub. No major impact on my electric bill either, and I set mine at 102-degrees. I enjoy this tub most every other day -- and the filtration system is good enough that I don't use chemicals beyond a little bromide tablets. Can't go wrong here folks!!
customer_reviews.author: W. C. Hess

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold up
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd season with this hot tub. I live in Minnesota so I can only use it about 3 months a year. I set it up last month for the season and this morning I work up to the side wall bulging out. One of the inner structures has ruptured. I have contacted Coleman to see if it is under warranty or if there is anything they can do. I will update this review once I hear back. I will also note that on 5/14/18 I paid $328 for this and now 2 years later it $642. That is crazy to me.
customer_reviews.author: ambergirl

customer_reviews.title: Purchased over a year ago still LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to put in my garage and its not to large and doesn't get in the way of my other toys (car, motorcycle, etc.). Great alternative for someone who loves hot tubs but cant afford the real thing. Easy and quick to set up! I've comfortably had 5 people in this thing and it feels quite lovely when the temp gets up closer to 100 (pre heat a day early!) and the 72 hour cutoff feature is nice! All in all I love this and I'm happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: ethan allen freeman

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I wasnt sure about this but I have to say its really nice. The walls are very sturdy, I can even stand on the wall. Although 4-6 people is crazy. 3 adults sitting is the real max unless your swingers and want to lay on each other. The pump is very quiet, the bubbles are loud but thats typical. It takes awhile to warm-up. The heater isn't really too powerful but it does do a good job of maintaining temperature. The chlorine device built in sucks, so you will need a chlorine float. The cover is very sturdy as well.
customer_reviews.author: B. Pavone

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: We have had the product for a week and so far no problems. We love it! The ONLY issue is the loss of heat like the other reviews mentioned but we already knew about it so we were prepared. We love in West Texas so we don’t necessarily need it too hot!! I would recommend a seat if you like to sit a little higher. I’m 5’4 and water comes to my neck when I sit all the way down. It arrived very quickly too.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality! Throw away item.after.a.few seasons! Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Only laster 3 season's! Not even 3!! We replaced the pump/heat control 3 times and not long.after putting it up for its 3rd season the internal chambers that are for the bubbles failed and allowed water into the system. We followed all setup and storage instructions and it made no difference! You expect something from Coleman to last and we're very disappointed! Don't buy! This is Junk!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Adams

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy Coleman Saluspa
customer_reviews.text: We have had this hot tub less than 3 months and heater no longer works. I have submitted a warrant claim to Bestway Corporation. They are dragging their feet replacing the unit even though there is suppose to be a 1 year warranty. Then I received a notification that "something went wrong" and I had to resubmit the warranty claim. I have tried to call numerous times. I got through to a person held after I held for over 30 minutes. She couldn't really tell me anything - wanted to troubleshoot exactly the same thing we had already done based upon what we found on their website. So, I seriously doubt we will ever get a replacement. STAY AWAY
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly A. LaVoie

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: While it was easy to assemble, this is not made for places like ny! It took a week to even get to 100 then when the bubbles are on you lose about 8 degrees. It doesn't hold temperature at all. It is not worth 600 at all. Very disappointing and complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Jj

customer_reviews.title: We keep getting Error code E02
customer_reviews.text: We like the hot tub - it's nice and hot and assembly was pretty easy. But every time we use the bubbles, it turns itself off with error code E02 saying there is a pump problem. When we disconnect the electricity and then plug it in again, it resets itself and works fine for a time - then, the error code comes again when we use the bubbles. We are contacting seller right now and will report back with their response.
customer_reviews.author: stephen endelman

customer_reviews.title: Cover Not Inflatable as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I like the size of the hot tub and thought it was easy to put together until we had issues inflating the lid that comes with it. There is no socket to inflate the lid and now the lid is filling up when it rans because its not inflatable and we are worried that it is going to break the sides of the hot tub. This was a more expensive inflatable hot tub and I am disappointed that the makers were supposed to supply an inflatable cover and failed.
customer_reviews.author: Bubbles

customer_reviews.title: Pending 4 Star.... Know that this motor won't heat the water in temps less than 39 degrees!
customer_reviews.text: Warning: this tub doesn't work in temps 39 degrees or lower. Also it is better to connect to a ground outlet vs extension cord/power bar. I am giving it 4 star based on set up. But we haven't used it yet. Our temps being winter time is > 39 degrees. Apparently the heater doesnt work unless it's warmer out. I never saw that disclaimer or anyone review it with that info. Once our temps raise and we actually get to use it ill update my stars/review based on that. Might try and build a box to insulate and increase warmth around the motor to get it to heat water. I'm in Snowy Seattle area!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Howell

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. Worse customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Unit lasted only a month when pump failed. Vendor told me a replacement is not available because of sanctions against China and they have no idea when a replacement will be available. When I asked for a refund or full replacement I was told neither are options. Now I have a non-functional tub of cold water sitting on my deck.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: It worked great for 8 months now shows E02 code
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for 8 months now shows E02 code. Changed filters, back washed pump and any other trouble shooting information I could find. Tried contacting manufacturer-still waiting for reply for 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle 1

customer_reviews.title: Going flat  in only 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this less than 5 months ago and already going flat. Been in same spot since installation only moved a foot when filling back up. Even put extra padding underneath. Very upset!!! Tried to contact Coleman but have yet to hear back. 🤬🤬🤬
customer_reviews.author: Lori Flake

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: So far all I have done is unflated it and am currently filling. I wanted to write this early review because so far I have noticed that mine did not got come with several things. Firstly it did not have a manual (thank God for the internet). Then I noticed that I did not have a ground mat. It's late spring here so I should be OK for a bit, but will need to find something soon ish. Also I did not receive a floating chemical dispenser. Which shouldn't be too much of an issue as i plan on using liquid chemicals. Other wise it's working great so far! Will update as I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Grohman

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Works Great. I set mine up using 2 4x8 sheets of plywood, toped it with the interlocking foam pad ( i got from harbour frt) then used the included pad. The bottom is very comfortable. The air bubbles do wonders for my back. I'm 6'6" and it fits me just great. Don't know why I waited so long to get one. From all my research before buying, I would never buy the Intex because of the pump. Do your own research on that!
customer_reviews.author: James Gill

customer_reviews.title: My friends love this, but I got a lemon.
customer_reviews.text: I have friends who have this hottub and love it. Ours worked once. I called Bestway for support. They finally agreed I have a lemon and said warranty replacement would be sent. However warranty parts are on backorder. They have ones they can sell to new customers but not ones for warranty replacements. I missed the return date waiting on my warranty replacement. Very fustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Nichols

customer_reviews.title: If you just want it for 9 months....
customer_reviews.text: Well, I wanted it to love this... It is a wonderful idea but it just didn't work long enough. I bought it for my parents for Christmas last year and they ended up giving it back to me because it cost too much. The temperature control was all over the place & never was consistent. Now the whole thing has shut down and I can't get it working again. A bit of a waste and a HUGE letdown.
customer_reviews.author: Haltra.

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: EASY set up. I watched a video and then set it up in less than 30 mins. It took about a day and a half for it to reach 104 degrees. But it was about 30 degrees outside. Over all I am very impressed and have no regrets about the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Temporary Spa
customer_reviews.text: We were able to set this up in minutes - everything is self contained. We only had to plug the unit into an outdoor outlet, fill it up and we were off and running. We've been in it practically every day - it has already paid for itself and then some. Only thing to note is that it can only comfortably fit two adults and one child. Not sure how they got 4 full grown adults in there.
customer_reviews.author: Super Dor

customer_reviews.title: One year in and still going!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing, it keeps the temp up even in snow and freezing weather! A year later I still get in it almost every day. Just have to know that the main pump unit needs to be at 42 degrees to operate, so when we change out the water and it is cold out we just keep the pump indoors until we are ready to hook it all up, then try and add some warm water to the unit stays up to temp. Once the water is up above 42 it all works great! I have had a foot of snow on the thing and it is still 104 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Youngs

customer_reviews.title: 3rd season and still going strong...
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! This is season 3 and it's still going strong. No air leaks,no water leaks, everything is functioning as if it was brand new. It doesn't quite look new anymore because I store it in an old shed that isn't waterproof, but I'm still impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L.

customer_reviews.title: no service during covd19
customer_reviews.text: i tried to complain about this item being defective but could not report it i would have liked it if it didnt leak water from the pump, it would have been helpful to be able to get hold of a person, understand due to covd19, but making this comment just to prove I had a problem before return policy expired.
customer_reviews.author: kitty hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Failed like clockwork at the 3 month mark
customer_reviews.text: After 3 months of hot tub bliss (I LOVED this when it was running), something happened to the electronic element of the unit and it would no longer turn on. After months of attempts to contact both companies (Coleman and Bestway), I have received no response. It sounds like many have struggled with this issue, and I would not recommend buying this particular model.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M.

customer_reviews.title: WORST BUY EVER !  It is too big and heavy to return.
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this twice but fail, so I am using this as a small pond now. The problem of this product is hot water heater. If you deliver hot water from hot water tank, it does not have the power to keep it. However I tried the temperature cannot go up over 95 degree. Water temperature booster does not have power. I waited 5 hours but it was no vain. This is just toy. I wanted to return but this package is too big, so you cannot even wrap it. So I wasted over $350 in vain.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Stays at 104 no matter what
customer_reviews.text: Our previous Intex Spa was MUCH easier to control. The timer on this unit is not only confusing but it really doesn't seem necessary. We get into the hot tub daily so having it go up and down in temperature seems counter-intuitive. We would like the spa to stay at 102, where we set the temperature but it is ALWAYS at 104. Hopefully this pump will last longer than the other brand and make these inconveniences worth the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pumps are not reliable. tub lasted a year half before getting a hole
customer_reviews.text: The spa itself is great for the price. It hasn't even been a full year since i purchased this spa and I'm on my third pump. The original started to leak and the first replacement pump they sent under warranty was bad right out of the box. Just got my second replacement hopefully this one works. Third Pump had issues too, sometimes it was super loud sometimes not,,, Now being June 6 2019, i ended up throwing this hot tub in the trash.. the tub got a bulge on the inside and then a pin hole leak in the seem. tried to patch it didn't work.... So i got year and half out of this product...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The hot water is great way to relax outside
customer_reviews.text: On one hand it's a three hundred dollar hot tub. The hot water is great way to relax outside, but the bubbles are terrible. However, our pump died in less than two weeks. Getting a replacement was an ordeal, requiring jumping through a ton of hoops on the phone support line. Replacement pump seems to work OK for now. Caused our electric bill to go up ~50% for the month that we used it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Snider

customer_reviews.title: It was great until it started leaking and drained it out
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used the heat feature yet. But after a few months of it set up one of the pipes to the pump has leaked and drained the whole thing. I don’t even know how to fix it. If I ever get around to calling then to see if they’ll replace the part I’ll update my review. I was super impressed with this product when it first came though. Maybe it’s just a fluke.... the walls of it are great, and the bottom is nice and padded too.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah O'Loughlin

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but never got to try it.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the Coleman hot tub but due to medical issues we were not able to set it up quickly and were close to the cut off date to return with a call tag which now were are over that time by a couple of days. We tried several days ago to inflate it, but the pumper would not stay on. I left a message for Coleman to call me and tried to call Amazon with no response. So yesterday, I emailed Amazon because you can not call them right now due to Covid 19, but no response from them either. it might have been a good product but I will never know. Joyce B
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I have had this tub for 6 months and am a satisfied customer. I set in up in a covered patio on a brick floor. It arrived and I had it running in 90 minutes out of the box. I heated it overnight and have never looked back. I use a bromine system. Get the 4 part bromine test strips and related chemicals and the water stays real nice. Pump - temp, timer, bubbles - works well. Keep pump on and clean filters regularly. I heated as needed in the summer and saw no change in power bill. I leave it on now in winter - affect on bill TBD. This is a good value. Satisfied customer thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: So a year later it’s held up.
customer_reviews.text: It’s faded a lot in total sun light. The pump still heats well. Don’t keep it on 100%. The pump had ability to leave on it set up to 48 hrs. It’s only bubbles not a jet like a Reg hot tub. That said it’s suprisingly well made. I’ve never had to add air to the exterior and the chorine float with a couple pool tabs has kept it clean. The paper filters completely dissolved and I only noticed that this week. Didn’t seem to have any effect on working. I don’t regret buying it but, there are better ways to spend $500
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Fun. Easy to set up. Really like it.
customer_reviews.text: I love it. My girlfriends parents have one and that’s the reason I bought mine. My girlfriend parents hot tub does have a small leak. I don’t know how hard it is to repair. They owned their for 3 years. I think this is a great product for the price. It’s fun. I think it’s worth the money. It’s perfect for us. Matthew
customer_reviews.author: Matthew P.

customer_reviews.title: The Hot Tub Is Great, But The Electronic Egg That comes with it ...
customer_reviews.text: The Hot Tub Is Great, But The Electronic Egg That comes with it not so good. The Thermostat Went out on the Second day we had it, Lucky I got Prime and they took care of it ASAP with a new one on its way.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Jo  Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this 3 years and used it several times weekly. It worked great and I love it. It probably would’ve lasted another 3 years but a power failure during single digit temperatures did it in. I maybe able to fix it but for only 350 I’d rather just buy a new one
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So happy with our purchase
customer_reviews.text: We love this! It's been a lot of fun over the holidays. It's not perfect but that's not what we expected for the price. We have previously had hot tubs but since having kids we didn't know how much we would use it. We have been using it more than ever. I had looked at these several times over the last few years and went back and forth thinking, why not just wait until we can get a real hot tub. But then one reviewer said. "80% of the hot tub for 5% of the price." and I agreed, "Why not?".
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Extremely easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is extremely easy to set up. The directions are hard to understand, but i figured it out some of the hook ups are self evident and was just as easy to,just do it. I ran hose from my tankless water heater so i started at temp. It seams to hold temp well. The controls are a bit sluggish but it seams to work. The blow up cover should cut heat loss when not in use, that should keep operating cost down.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Almost like a real hot tub.  Timer function useless
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Like 75% of the functionality of a “real” hot tub. Water gets warm and stays warm. Biggest complaint is the timer function is useless. Especially if you want it to warm at night (when electricity is cheaper) and turn off during the day. No way to do that. Fits 4 people... 2 kids and 2 adults. 4 adults is very tight.
customer_reviews.author: Sumeet Jain

customer_reviews.title: Great, but will not last
customer_reviews.text: In 3 years I've had 5 of these, 2 I've purchased and 3 were warranty replacements and now the pump has died again. I love this hot tub and you cant beat the price, however, they will not last. Warranty process is easy, but I'm now 1.5 months over warranty and my pump has died for the 5th time. The best advice I have is deciding if the price is worth it for approximately 1.5 years of use with the need of a warranty replacement during that time.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: They love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hot tub for my kids . They love it and usually go on it almost every Sunday (i turn the machine on the night before so that it will ready and hot on Sunday) The only thing i wish this hot tub had is a sitting area!! because in my case (I'm ony 5 feet tall) i havr to seat on my knees in order to be comfortable with the water level , my husband whos 5"9 sits perfectly on the bottom and loves it! Kids never really want to sit so for them is perfect too!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Sarah

customer_reviews.title: But I got it set up pretty quickly and within 2 days it was fully heated ...
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are not much help. But I got it set up pretty quickly and within 2 days it was fully heated to 104. I go in it almost every other day and it is a real treat to have an enjoy. Especially for the price! it DOES not fit 4 adults. In the picture for the product, I would love to know where those 4 adults legs actually are.... Perfect for two people (maybe 3). Stays clean with a chlorine tab in the provided chlorine floater. Again for the price, if you have been wanting a hottub but dont want to commit with the $ and time and upkeep this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: E2 Error Code
customer_reviews.text: Got an E2 error code the first week of use. I was running the heater and bubbler at the same time. The error cleared immediately by unplugging and replugging the unit. Got another E2 error a week later and that has affected the spa's ability to heat over 99 degrees. I have downloaded and tried every cure on the internet both from individual users / owners and Coleman recommendations. The is a not uncommon error and apparently can be fatal. Fortunately I did not pay $5,000 for this spa and can consider it a learning experience.
customer_reviews.author: JANET K WATTS

customer_reviews.title: Just buy one don't be cautious
customer_reviews.text: I love this spa paid under 400 bucks for this desired item during this pandemic. Use it everyday and absolutely love it sure the lid loses air and when the bubbles are going the heater cools down. IDC this is freaking awesome I'd even pay 900 bucks for this one. I'm 6' my girlfriend is 5'7" and we fit with room for 4 more.
customer_reviews.author: Tacorollin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hot tub!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases I have made in the last several months! It consistently keeps its 104° temperature (even when it's cold and windy outside!). It's very easy to put together (I did it myself in under 20 minutes). The self inflating connection is awesome. The sides are nice and sturdy so when it gets too hot inside the tub, you can easily take a seat on the sides. It fits 2 people perfectly....and 3 people (so long as you're friends!). I'm not sure 4 people would be a comfy fit. I highly recommend this hot tub!!!
customer_reviews.author: Summer Tanasi

customer_reviews.title: Liner and cover DO NOT not hold air
customer_reviews.text: Sadly this is our hot tub. We were so excited about it but it's not holding air. We've got a warranty claim in with bestway but they have been non-responsive so far it's been 7 business days. If we don't hear back in the next day, we will likely be returning this item. Returned, customer disapointment.
customer_reviews.author: AngPing

customer_reviews.title: This is such a great little hot tub.
customer_reviews.text: Well we bought this for our deck at the beach. So far it's been a little rainy, but we've gotten in several times. The first experience was pure joy, the temperature reached 104. The steam and warm warm water was rejuvenating after a 2 1/2 hour drive to the beach. However, please note that it takes about a day to get the temperature to 104. I have gotten in it with a temperature of 85-95 and it is still comfortable. It is nice after a long stressful drive or hectic day. I love It!!!
customer_reviews.author: DORNONs

customer_reviews.title: using daily this will only last one year
customer_reviews.text: It was great while it lasted but it has a serious weak link. The propeller of this unit spins on what seems to be a porcelain shaft that over the time of a year will wear out and break. Once this happens you will get an unclearable E02 error and your pump will not turn on. You cna find the replacement shaft in a different material but now since your prop is warped it also will only last a short time. The prop itself is not a replacement item that they will sale to you.
customer_reviews.author: jason frazier

product_meta.title: Coleman SaluSpa Inflatable Hot Tub Spa, Green & White
product_meta.description: Sink into the warm, bubbling Coleman air jet spa to relax, unwind & lounge around after a long, hard day! The air jet bubbles are released from the bottom of the spa to create a warm, bubbling hot tub environment. These soothing bubbles will help you relax & unwind. This Spa’s inflatable walls are made of durable, puncture-resistant, UV-resistant Tritech material to prevent damage & to retain its shape no matter how many times it is inflated & deflated. The Coleman spa comes with a reinforced cover with safety clips for extra insulation. This spa set also comes with a pump that inflates it, heats it up, runs filtration & Controls the massage system, along with a chemconnect chemical dispenser. The connect dispenser maintains clean, healthy water by providing a stable level of chlorine That is evenly dispersed throughout the spa.
feature_bullets: KICK UP YOUR FEET: Relax at the touch of a button with the 77" x 77" x 28" Lay Z Massage system, soothing AirJet system, rapid heating system, and integrated water filtration
SECURE YOUR SPA: Leatheroid pool cover with double safety lock clips and built-in air chamber for insulation

COMPLETE CONTROL: Digitally controlled pump with soft-touch control panel to meet the needs of 4-6 adults. Heat the water up to 104 degrees or use the automatic start/stop timer-controlled heating system
PRESSURE TESTED: This hot tub inflates in minutes with TriTech inflated walls for durability and comfort and cushioned floor with convenient drain valve.
SAFETY FIRST: Pre-tested pump and pre-tested hot tub and a ground fault circuit interrupter (GFCI) that trips at 6mA

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars2,544 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
